item.title: Anticircumvention Law is Not the Right Solution to Webscraping
item.description: In the webscraping cases now pending, courts should focus their analysis on whether there has been actual harm to the plaintiffs’ web infrastructures, instead of allowing digital platforms absolute control via ToS or TPMs.

item.title: The Value of Public Domain Day
item.description: Out of roughly 16,000 eligible books, movies, or music, no more than five percent could expect to earn more than a total of $100 in the space of 20 years. The rest of the works—more than 15,000 of them—were expected to be worth less than five dollars per year (economically speaking) to their rights holders.
